intro: Senecio guicanensis, commonly known as the Guianan groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically found in Guyana and Suriname. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, attracting various pollinators like bees and butterflies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Senecio guicanensis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
